preguntas.enunciado: El valor del aclaramiento de creatinina es un  índice adecuado para estimar la tasa de:

preguntas.enunciado: Sobre la glucosa a nivel renal, es correcto que:

Explanation: Glucose is mostly reabsorbed in the proximal tubule of the nephron, but a small amount is also reabsorbed in the distal tubule. The limit of glucose reabsorption is defined by the concept known as tubular maximum (Tm). At high concentrations in the urine, glucose reaches its Tm and will not be further reabsorbed. preguntas.enunciado: En un individuo infectado por el virus de la  inmunodeficiencia humana tipo 1 (VIH-1), ¿Cuál es el primer marcador detectable en  sangre?:

When an individual is infected with the Human Immunodeficiency Virus type 1 (HIV-1), one of the earliest detectable signs of infection is the presence of viral RNA in the blood, before the immune system has had a chance to produce specific antibodies. The detection of viral RNA is therefore an important diagnostic marker for HIV infection. Antibodies such as IgM and IgG are produced later during the course of the disease as part of the immune response to fight the virus, but they are not the first detectable markers in blood. The antigen p2 is a viral protein that can be detected in later stages of infection.

preguntas.enunciado: En la evolución de la infección por el virus de la  inmunodeficiencia humana tipo 1 (VIH-1), ¿cuál es el nivel de linfocitos T CD4+ en sangre que  marca  la  aparición  de  la  inmunodeficiencia?:
preguntas.mistral_texto: The correct answer is number 1: 200 CD4+/µL. This level of CD4+ T cells in the blood, also known as a CD4 count, is considered a diagnostic marker for the development of immunodeficiency associated with HIV-1 infection. A CD4 count below 200 cells per microliter (µL) indicates immune system compromise and puts individuals at risk of opportunistic infections and diseases.

preguntas.enunciado: La onda T del electrocardiograma corresponde  a:
preguntas.mistral_texto:
The correct answer is number 2: La despolarización de los ventrículos.

The wave T on the electrocardiogram (ECG) represents the depolarization phase of the ventricles, which happens after the atria have already been depolarized (wave P) and contracted to push blood into the ventricles. The ventricular depolarization is followed by their contraction (wave QRS), and then repolarization (wave T again). The wave T reflects the recovery of the ventricular myocardium cells after they have been contracted, and it can be affected by various factors such as age, sex, and some cardiovascular diseases.
